title: Umbilical cord serum concentrations of perfluorooctane sulfonate, perfluorooctanoic acid, and the body mass index changes from birth to 5 1/2 years of age
description: Bone marrow contains adipocytes, which have been thought to form one type of marrow adipose tissue (MAT). Here, the authors identify two MAT subpopulations in mice and humans—‘regulated’ and ‘constitute’ MAT—which show distinct phenotypic and cellular traits, and respond differently to cold exposure.
authors: nature, search, Takanobu Horikoshi, Tomoko Nishimura, Kenji J. Tsuchiya, Simon Kornvig, Maria Wielsøe, Eva Cecilie Bonefeld-Jørgensen, Hilde B. Lauritzen, Tricia L. Larose, Geir W. Jacobsen, Erica L. Scheller, Casey R. Doucette, Ormond A. MacDougald, Virginie Girault, Vianney Gilard, Soumeya Bekri
